page.title: 02Landscape of Hunshelf.
page.content: The area rises to over 300 metres.The northern two-thirds of the area is a plateau or gently sloping dip slope, while the southern third is a scarp running steeply down to Stocksbridge, over 100 metres below. Plantations and isolated farmsteads are scattered over the plateau surface,which is dissected by several small becks and cloughs. The man-made Underbank Reservoir in the south-west corner is over 1km. long and provides water for industries and recreation. The eastern boundary of the area is formed by the Little Don river valley,whose steep sides are masked by trees.
